channel.title: Redis Quickstart on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in Redis Quickstart on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Redis Quickstart
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Redis QuickStart This tutorial will show you how to use KubeDB to run a Redis server. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using kind. Now, install KubeDB cli on your workstation and KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.
